subject: Re: [junit] need help
msgSnippet: ... You can use `instanceof` when you know the type you want when you write the code. You can t use it to see if one object has the same type as another. And,
messageBody:
On Tuesday 22 March 2005 10:11, sadia zai wrote:
> shudn't i use 'instanceOf " operator to do it ?????

You can use `instanceof` when you know the type you want
when you write the code. You can't use it to see if one object
has the same type as another.

And, if you want to abstract your assertions, you'll end up
using the getClass() and/or isInstance/isAssignableFrom anyway.

[IE if you want to get better messages than you'd get from

assertTrue( spoo instanceof WhateverClass );
]

> coz i want to check that method returns the required type or not .....
>
> Andrew McDonagh <andrew.mcdonagh@...> wrote:
>
> Chris Dollin wrote:
> >On Monday 21 March 2005 10:46, sadia zai wrote:
> >>i want to test the types of two objects are same or not ,,
> >>how can i do dis
> >
> >(guessing)
> >
> > assertEquals( O1.getClass(), O2.getClass() );
>
> you can also use...
>
>
> assertTrue(o1.getClass().isInstance(o2.getClass());
>
> See
> http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#isInstance(jav
>a.lang.Object
>
> or
>
> assertTrue(o1.getClass().isAssignableFrom(o2.getClass());
>
> http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.4.2/docs/api/java/lang/Class.html#isAssignableFr
>om(java.lang.Class)
>
